CommentsContent: I found this unit in search of the quietest AC Unit.  This superior design is like a mini-split. CommentsTitle: EC 07 Fix! Had issues out of the box but got to work!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 April 12, 2023
CommentsContent: Had issues directly out of the box, error code EC 07. Went through trouble shooting with the company and didn’t really help so decided to trouble shoot myself, noticed the condenser fan was kicking on and looked stuck and blocked. So i opened the back top side and found that the fan was getting stuck on some hard malleable black sticky stuff that was around hard pipes that lead to the condenser. I was able to form what i think is some type of insulation out of the way from the fan which allowed the fan to have enough room to spin. Put the AC back together and now works fine.This saved a trip to return to ups and the headache of getting a replacement.AC now blows cold and is super quiet, other than the above issues I’m satisfied with the product.

CommentsTitle: Quiet but there are too many air gaps
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 April 11, 2023
CommentsContent: Overall it's a good AC unit. It is quiet, so that's the best part. What I don't like is that there are too many gaps even after using all of the foam strips and panels that come with it. The bottom gaps are very obvious. I tried to seal them with duck tape, but apparently that's not enough because where I live, it's always windy, and the wind blows a great amount of dirt into the room from underneath the unit. Although I also used duck tape to seal the top and sides, in addition to the foam that came with it, dirt also comes in from the top and sides. That room, which is being used as a home office, is always so so dirty, as compared to the other bedrooms. I tried to see if I could buy new side panels to try to reinstall the unit in an effort to better seal the gaps, but the manufacturer only sells the thin black foam strips, which can be found anywhere (ex. Lowe's.) They DO NOT sell the side hard foam white panels that have the appearance of foam poster boards but thicker. I even chatted with one of their customer representatives, and they confirmed that they don't sell those. That's ridiculous!

CommentsTitle: Pleasure to use, A demon to install, Warranty statement full of loop holes - Buyer Beware
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 April 9, 2023
CommentsContent: Read the installation manual and decide if you can install it.  It took me half a day and I've installed a great many window AC's in the last 50 years.  (My Big Bend Texas ranch house has 5 right now.)  It's just a very complex installation that will vary greatly on your specific window and sill design and construction.  It's not the typical unbox, place in window, pull the sides in place and turn it on AC.  As to claims of quiet and energy efficiency:  All Claims are Absolutely True - nothing like it - get the specs from others - 15 on the Energy Star scale (max wattage is only 750) only 42 decibels loud (near silent), and very cold.  Mine arrived in an unblemished box, but upon opening showed signs of poor assembly and negligent packing.  Strongly suggest you buy a third party warranty since Midea's warranty statement has so many expensive loop holes that I believe it to be in violation of the Uniform Commercial Code.  In short - buy it from a company that will install it and service it if you can (not an option in the wilderness where I live).

I am annoyed because this was a selling point for me, as it sits near the front of my home, and anything that can reduce "that window air conditioner look" would be a big plus. This unit performs so well, however, that I elected to keep it. I did paint the exterior housing and support bracket to match the house, so it blends in much better than out of the box, but I am nonetheless disappointed with the false representation of the product's appearance.

CommentsTitle: 5 star unit but system for foam sealing is slightly awkward
CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年4月2日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I am truly awed by the design and function of this air conditioner, a machine that I've always taken for granted and largely ignored. As someone who has owned probably 10 window units in my life, this one's design is really a breath of fresh air (pun intended!). It's not just the fact that the window can go through the unit, which let's in a surprising amount of natural light that would otherwise be lost, it's also how well designed the safety precautions and unit-window fit are. The operation is quiet as heck, and the unit cools the place down fast. Moreover, in my opinion anyway, the price difference between this unit and a traditional one is really acceptable (~$150).Installation was easy, basically you just screw the support bracket into your window sill and let gravity do the rest. Where I would knock off .01 star—there are 4 different foam materials that come with the unit to fill in the negative space. In one case, you are surrounding a large foam block with foam ribbon. In another, you are taping adhesive foam to cover holes in the bracket. In both cases, there is not enough foam ribbon or adhesive foam, and my window is only 32" wide. Easy enough, just bought more at hardware store, but I was surprised that even after applying the four different foam materials as instructed, there was still a lot of space left to fill, especially considering how well everything else was designed (including the app). Def an amazing purchase.

CommentsContent: The product kept tripping my circuit breaker after about 5 to 10 seconds of plugging it in. I have another portable unit that I use on the same outlet that uses considerably more power and has no issue. I called support to try to figure out if I should order a new one, and when I was asking about the product, they refused to help me and acted stupid until I gave them a model number.  I told them him it was the 8000 BTU window slotted unit that you could open and close your window with.  I told him I didn’t care about the unit I had because I’m sending it back and I’m going to order another one. I want to make sure I won’t have the same issue, but they kept concentrating on the unit that I had packed up in my garage and wanted me to go out there to get the actual model off the box. I have done support before and I knew my products well enough to provide support based on basic product information.  It is literally the first product that comes up. When you look at the window air conditioners.  They paid Slater from saved by the bell to do an advertisement for them for this air conditioner, and they acted like they had no idea what air conditioner I was talking about.  I actually asked for a supervisor and she got all pompous and said, why did you need a supervisor?!?!Also, the installation was awful. The foam pieces didn’t fit very well and weren’t very flexible, if that is the right word.  I had to cut slots into the foam to get it to go into the grooves of where the window slides.  There were still gaps, also gaps under the air conditioner where bugs can get in.All this effort installing it is, it didn’t even work. Do yourself a favor and plug it in first to see if trips your circuitry.  first picture is their unit power usage, and the second picture is the portable one I use with no issue in the same exact outlet.  The portable one uses far more power without any issues. I plugged into a UPS and left the UPS plugged in and same issue.  No erratic power I will spikes when the unit tripped the circuit though  Nothing for several minutes of letting it run on the ups to show any irregularities to cause it to keep tripping the circuit.  This is also with turning everything else in the room off.  The higher power portable air conditioner runs fine with everything else on in the room. The portable air conditioner is a 6.6 seer rating and the window unit is a 15 seer rating.  It makes no logical sense why this much of lower wattage unit is causing such an issue.  I guess I will never know because their support refused to help me because I wouldn’t go out to my garage to get the model number. All I wanted was confirmation that the unit was defective and this wasn’t normal.

CommentsTitle: Not recommended for humid climate - lack of drainage hole causes stagnant and odorous water buildup
CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年3月27日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: Bought this unit 3 months ago based on good general reviews and innovative designs. Installation was pretty easy and I followed directions to make sure it slanted backwards. Unit ran well and was good at meeting my cooling needs; everything seemed great at first.About 2 months in, started noticing a foul smell whenever the fans first start running from idle. Cleaned out the filter but the issue persisted. Started googling about this and discovered that many people had complaints with mold growth in this unit due to difficulty in taking the unit apart for cleaning, and also lack of drainage hole in the outside portion.I finally took the unit down and opened it up outside after the smell became unbearable and started to negatively affect my health. I discovered that about a third of the bottom of the outside unit is constantly submerged in about an inch and half of gross brownish gunky water filled dead bugs and god knows what. This water just sits there stagnant in the back of the ac, not high enough to spill out of the overflow, and a sniff confirmed that this was indeed the source of the same smell that I was getting indoors.After researching extensively into this topic, I found that Midea purposely doesn't have drainage holes in this unit so the fan can scope up the residual water buildup and splash it around as a cooling mechanism to save energy. There are however problems I found with this explanation; First of all, the circular scoop that the fan uses to pick up the water doesn't sit flush against the bottom of the case; Its actually about an inch up. This means that there needs to be at least an inch of water inside the case for it to even start using this feature. Unless this water is freshly condensed and then evaporates out routinely, you are going to have a stagnant water buildup inside this case, especially if you live anywhere humid like I do. What ends up happening is that you get a pool of gunky water filled with gross mold and whatnots, that the fan then picks up and proceeds to splash on all the fins in the machine, which eventually translates to unpleasant odor being blown into your room whenever it starts up.I rather not be breathing nasty, disease causing air compared to Midea hitting an energy saver milestone. At least give us the option of drain holes with plugs or something so we can choose between efficiency vs cleanliness . Unless you live somewhere really dry, or doesn't need to use this thing often, I cannot recommend a purchase of this unit. Giving it two stars because it actually works well with cooling (so far), but this is a major issue.Also. the fans on the indoor portion of the ac cannot be reached to be cleaned unless you take the entire front portion apart, unhooking wires, cables and all. Very unfriendly design for sustainable general maintenance.
PurchasemModel_Size: 尺寸: 8000 BTU样式: 交流电
PurchasemModel_Color: 尺寸: 8000 BTU样式: 交流电

CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年3月5日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I bought the 8,000 BTU Midea window unit for our master bedroom and now I can set the thermostats for both floors up to about 80° during the night and my master bedroom can be set on 67° for the night. We are empty nesters so this works for us. If your other bedrooms are occupied you probably have to run your central unit or put one of these small units in each bedroom. I don't see the reason to cool my entire 3100 sq ft two story home during the night just to make it comfortabel in the 200 sq ft master bedroom. My electric bill dropped to about 1/3 of what it was and we sleep at a much cooler temperature. The unit is also very quiet on lower speeds. It has a variable speed motor so after the room cools down the unit will run at such a low speed you cannot even hear it. The vent only stays open when the AC is running and sometimes I'll walk by and the vent is open and I'm thinking "is that thing running". And I'll put my hand in front of it and I can feel cold air coming out. Although when  you first turn it on and it's running on high speed you can hear it but its more of a louder humm.The only Con is that about once a year you have to vacuum the blades of the squirrel cage fan that blows the cold air or air flow slow down to about nothing. And Midea put some sort of wire quard in front of the squirrel cage fan blade that prevents easy cleaning. Here's what I did; take a pair of pliers and just pull the wire quard out of the unit. To do this you have to bend the air flow cover up in the center and pop it off the two pegs that hold it in to be able to get at the fan. Then pull the grey plastic air diverter blades up out of the holes and set them aside. Then with a pair of pliers or wire cutters pull that damn wire guard out so you get a vacuum in there and vacuum the fan blades. You can probably expect to do this once a year. Once you get the guard out of the way and toss it in the trash the rest of the job is really easy to do once or twice a year.I like the wi-fi app making it easy to set the temp way down. We can be across town and before we are heading home for the evening I'll open my app and turn the unit on. By the time we get up to the bedroom it's 67° while the outside temp is a blazing 100° and the rest of the house is set to 80°. This little unit has paid for itself in the first few months.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年2月26日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: This is The Most quietest window AC unit we have ever owned...period!  We set the temperature the day that we installed it and haven't touched it since. We keep it on auto fan and eco cool and the little unit comes on and adjust things on it's own as needed to keep our desired temperature. We've never even put batteries into the remote as we really don't need it. The first unit arrived damaged and Amazon had it picked up and a new one delivered within the week.As a matter of fact, we liked this unit so much that we ordered two more of different BTU sizes to fit our needs....Why?...Because our central air needs to be completely replaced after 20 years and they want almost $9,000 to put in the new outside compressor and the inside blower unit. So these 3 window units are keeping our home just as cool and we saved $7,500 by Not replacing the central air.  Plus, if one goes bad one day, we can just slide it out ourselves and slide a new one in. (Will NEVER have to call some AC company to come out and charge us a fortune ever again)!And financially speaking, with the $7,500 that we saved, we could buy another 15 window units!!! That's right, another 15 window AC units.!!! So as long as our Midea units keep working like they should, we are making out like bandits.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年2月22日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I’m a contractor and I build and install things all week long every week, year round. I installed this unit for a client today in a attic of a log cabin. Took me about 2.5 hrs to install it. First time I installed this model. I took my time and watched a YouTube video on how to do the installation. The YouTube video was excellent.  All the parts were in the box.  I did have to add cedar shims on the outside of the house for the angle brackets.  I also added some larger deck screws into the window bracket into the window frame. Just to be safe.  The tools I used were impact driver, drill bit to pre drill, a small screw driver, a large screw driver, tape measure, extra deck screws, pencil, a knife to cut the insulation foam.  You would not have to have a impact driver to do this project. I did have a hard time getting the anti tip brackets out after I installed the unit. My suggestion is to take the clear tape off and make sure the anti tip brackets go in and out before you install the unit. The anti tip brackets were kind of hidden. Otherwise it wasn’t that bad to install.  Hope this helps.It’s a neat and well thought out design.

CommentsTitle: Hardware good - Software bad & getting worse.
CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年2月22日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I love the physical air conditioner itself, it’s quiet and efficient and cools very well and it installs easily.  The phone app for controlling the AC used to work great, but Midea is trying to force everyone onto a new app that fails to connect to the AC the majority of the time which makes this formerly great AC very frustrating to use. I have an iPhone and the App Store also shows that the new app will access my photos and videos and audio recordings— that seems entirely unnecessary for an app that is just supposed to turn on/off an air conditioner and set the temperature.  In conclusion, if you are satisfied using the buttons on the unit, or the included remote control, then this is a great air conditioner, but if you’d like to control the AC remotely or from a smart device then be prepared for frustration and failure.

CommentsContent: Third one now.  They are like having a mini-split system without having to mess with charging gas lines and running tubes.  Very quiet compared to the old fashioned AC boxes.  The variable speed compressor motor being able to run at only the speed needed is such a great improvement over the old style.  We ran 3 of these all summer and our electric bill did go up but not nearly what it used to with the central air system.  At least $100 a month lower.  I'm going to get a 4th one for next Summer to complete my whole house cooling system.  It's definitely worth paying a bit more for this than for a regular box AC.  The lower noise level is worth it for just that alone.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年2月11日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: My wife hates noise in the bedroom at night, but she also hates being too warm in bed, so an air conditioner, for the bedroom is always been a compromise for us.Until we found this one. This machine has a revolutionary design that keeps the “noisy parts” outside the window, where it keeps squirrels awake. On the inside of the window is only a vent and some controls, making for a significantly quieter experience than any air conditioner we’ve ever tried, including a couple that are supposed to be “the worlds quietest”.We used it all summer in ‘22, so only one year of use on this so far, but it worked without a hiccup, and the noise level seemed like less than half of anything we had previously.If I had four thumbs, they would all be pointed up for this product! :-)

CommentsTitle: IT BROKE AFTER A YEAR AND 5 MONTHS.  ***UPDATE!! THE COMPRESSOR CAMEBACK TO WORK AGAIN BY ITSELF!!
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年12月26日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: UPDATE!! THE COMPRESSOR CAME BACK TO WORK BY ITSELF AGAIN!I just disconnected the AC, took it  to another room, mounted it in the window, away from the heater, plugged it into  the wall outlet and the compressor started to work again. It doesn't give me the "EC07" compressor defective message anymore.  I have been testing it for 3 weeks now, and it is working fine.!  I think that the problem was that in my bedroom where the AC was before, it was receiving too much heat from the heater that was underneath, and that might have affected the electronic part  of the AC.(December 26, 2022)This MIDEA unit broke down after a year and 5 months.It started giving the "EC07" DEFECTIVE MESSAGE., This means the "COMPRESSOR FAILED, IT BROKE DOWN".I called customer service, they advise to call the repair company.They said they won't repair it because their warranty only lasts one year.This unit also has problem common with other AC unit: the fan collects mold and heavy dust inside the fan.I called the company and they don't offer any advise on how to clean it; they said you should call a repair service to clean it and you have to pay for it.The company also doesn't recommend to spray water to clean the dust and mold.  And also they don't recommend you to do it yourself.This is how other people clean the other brand of AC that they have.Other people had the same problem, according with the reviews I checked.I am searching for a new AC unit from another brand.

In order to avoid health problems, I’ll  be throwing this Midea AC out and purchasing a unit that’s made to use long-term and designed to be serviced every year.

CommentsTitle: This thing is quiet... almost TOO quiet!
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年11月23日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: Came across this model before the summer really kicked in after shopping around for a replacement for our old AC unit that started to sound like a popcorn machine. Claims of energy efficiency crossed with a nearly silent operation sounded pretty good. Checked reviews (not just Amazon ones, either) and decided to try it out. In my case, installation was *bit* tricky being on the 4th floor with no outside access, and a bit of an oddball window setup. But I was able to, by trial and error, get it setup and level. I turned it on and... I thought it was broken it was so quiet compared to the previous unit (before the popcorn thing). Because of the reported efficiency, I was able to go from a 10,000 to this 8,000 BTU size. And it was perfect- just as cool as the previous larger noisier unit. Installing the App and setting up a schedule was, after some fiddling, no real trouble and did work fine. One caveat I did find, is when you remotely turn it on (if I was not using the scheduler) to have it cool off the room while on my way home, once I DID get home the remote would not change the temperature, fan speed, etc... Seems the App would override the remote or something. I finally figured out that you need to press the Power Button, which 'wakes up' the Unit and releases control to the remote. A bit odd, but livable, all things considered. The other issue is, living in an urban environment, that this unit might be TOO quiet. Previous unit was a "white noise" generator, covering the sounds of traffic, ambulances, loud exhaust noise, etc... Almost comforting. this unit has the compressor located outside the window and being so quiet, then let in all that outside noise! So I had to get used to that "Urban Soundscape" again and learn to block it out like all urbanites tend to do. Definitely would recommend and buy again if needed!

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年11月18日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: The first house i ever bought in south MS 30 years ago had a monster of a window unit, the only good thing about it was it could drown out the sound of trains going through my back yard, in hot summers it could cost more to run than the actual house payment. i never thought i would want another window unit in my lifetime but lately i have used a couple of roll around units in the 10-12000 btu range and they sucked. So i broke down and  found this Midea that came highly recommended by Reggie, yeah, that Reggie. I goth the 10K unit, installed it myself, even though it says not to, and had it going in less than an hour. If you get this unit, please get someone to help with the install, you aren't me after all.  I have it installed in my bedroom window and i can watch tv at night with this unit on full blast, although i never keep it on full blast, it would be an icebox if i did. Keeps roughly 300 sq ft cool on lowest setting. If you actually read these long pointless reviews just to try and figure out if  you  should buy this unit, quit wasting your time reading the ramblings of amateurs (at best) and just get it, you will not regret it, its a great, efficient, quiet, and easy to install unit.

CommentsTitle: Best window AC I've ever had. Perfect.
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年11月8日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I have the 8,000 BTU model.1) Noise:  This is by far the most quiet AC I’ve ever had.  No loud thunk when the compressor kicks on.  It’s just a soft, low hum.  The fan alone is extremely quiet.  I actually prefer a little more noise because I live in NYC, but I just use my white noise machine.2) Buttons/Operation:  Buttons are super clear, have a nice tactile response, and cover almost every function.  The only thing you cannot do with a button is turn off the *beep* noise (which happens every time you press a button or change a setting either on the ac itself or using the remote), or turn off the LED lights.3) Remote:  Remote is great although I really never use it.  I just use the app.  The best thing about the remote is the ability to turn off the LED lights.  The unit emits zero light with this turned off.  It’s such a great function!  No bright lights bothering me while I sleep!4) App:  The app seems janky at first, but it’s actually amazing.  It works perfectly — it even allows you to control the ac from OUTSIDE your home!  You can turn it on an hour before you get home to make sure it’s nice and cool, or turn it off if you forgot to before you left.  I LOVE the ability to pre-cool my apartment.You can also create schedules, favorite settings, see outdoor vs indoor temperature, change temperature units, and lots of other things.  It’s a fantastic add-on that adds to the value immensely.5) Cooling ability:  the unit works pretty fast, but not crazy fast.  You can change the direction of the air flow manually by swiveling the airflow gates, which makes a difference.  It cools a room off I’d say within 20 minutes, depending on how hot it is.6) Other:  it has these really robust plastic pull tabs in the back that prevent the window from being pulled up.  This is a great safety precaution for intruders, but also for kids playing around with the window.  And you cannot push this thing in or out; it ain’t goin no where.Single Downside:  I have blackout blinds in my bedroom that are 2” wide and the unit blocks them from going all the way to the sill.  I have been using a piece of cardboard behind the unit against the glass to keep sunlight/morning light from getting in and waking me up.  I wish my blind wasn’t so wide.You have about 1.5” maximum of clearance between the unit and the inside of the window against the glass, so any blind with a width less than that would still work.That’s it!  It’s freaking awesome. If you have been wavering on buying it, pull the trigger.  It’s and incredible, innovative, quiet and safe alternative to the traditional window unit.
PurchasemModel_Size: 尺寸: 8000 BTU样式: 交流电
PurchasemModel_Color: 尺寸: 8000 BTU样式: 交流电

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年11月7日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: Yes, this AC is as advertised: it's quiet, it's efficient, and it's difficult to install.However, be warned: due to this unit's surge in popularity, Midea DOES NOT HAVE ANY SPARE PARTS. This means that if any part is damaged or broken upon arrival (not unlikely, since most of these units are being shipped thousands of miles), OR just from the basic day-to-day wear-and-tear that any room unit goes through, Midea will NOT be able to REPLACE the part for you, even if they acknowledge you're entitled to a replacement.I received my AC at the end of August -- a part arrived broken. I nonetheless decided to install the AC, trusting that Midea's warranty would cover their faulty manufacturing. When I emailed them about the problem, it took days for them to respond, and I had to jump through various hoops, sending photos, copies of my receipt, and a statement that "I did not break the piece myself." Once they confirmed that I was entitled to a refund, they informed me that the piece (the Front Grille, essential for the maintenance of any window unit) would be sent as soon as the unit was once again available, in ONE MONTH!Since then, two months have passed, and I still do not have the part -- they delayed sending the part twice after I courteously asked when I could expect to receive it, and they are now refusing to answer any of my emails.If you want to take a gamble, I recommend you get this unit. Otherwise, I'd recommend getting a Danby --  they have highly personalized customer service, great products, and are North American-made (Midea is a Chinese corporation).

CommentsTitle: Works very well but the inside case is weak.
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年10月23日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: After 2 summers, 2 installs, and 2 removals, this AC cools very well and is quiet and efficient.My only problem is the lower right part of the inside case which has now had a 1" chip of plastic break off.Was it cracked when I got it or was it damaged from the strain put on by the very heavy power cord which comes out of this corner.  As a result, the inside grill sags a bit and may need to be taped on next summer if I can't glue the piece back on.  Taping will complicate cleaning the air filter, etc.Looking at this, the plastic design of the inside case in this area is not strong enough for the strain and interaction between the power cord and the grill support which goes through the hole.Over time this chip could crack further and compromise the inside case.  I guess I'll try to see if reasonably priced replacement parts are available?

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年10月18日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: We bought several of the 12,000 BTU units for our house that had no A/C Units. Positives - fairly easy to install, super quiet operation, and did a great job keeping things cool.That is, until we started having issues. The first thing we ran into was one of the units - thankfully while I was in the room - made a sudden whining noise and smoke started coming from it. Turned out the internal fan had seized and it was attempting to keep turning it. It would definitely have caught fire had I not been in the room and immediately shut it off.We then started looking at the other two we had, and I discovered something nearly as bad - all of them had mold/mildew problem inside the units. I'm not the only one seeing this, and it turns out there's no way to open the unit to clean the inside of it. We had to pull all of the units. So while we loved them while they worked, I wouldn't recommend purchasing Midea U units with those two major flaws.

CommentsTitle: Best Window A/C Unit I have ever had
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年10月16日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: First of all, we bought this for the fact that it is supposed to be quiet.  My wife is a light sleeper and the cycling on and off of our old unit would always wake her up, and it had the loudest beep when you turned it on, off, or changed the temps.  So I spent many summer nights way too warm to sleep.  No more! This thing is QUIET! You can turn the beeps off so that's a huge plus in my life.  I can set this, and go to sleep and you can not ever hear it turn on older than a faint and quiet little high pitch whistle.  I didn't think about it until we had it but you can use the app to turn it on from anywhere. SO when those hot days creep in and all the humans are at work, I can open the app, see the current temp inside the bedroom and turn it on to cool the room down for all the fur babies. Less than a sec long and barely noticeable. It works great, cools the room fast, gets really cold if you want it to, it's quiet, no annoying beeps, has a remote, easy to use app with favorite settings...seriously, buy it.  This thing made summer less of a pain and everyone was happy with the purchase.  The only cons and they are so minor.... is the foam stuff they give you isn't super great, and if you have blinds then you will need to black out the window on the sides of the unit if you don't want sun coming in, but I can find or purchase stuff cheap to fix such things. Very happy with this purchase!

The interior air fan, which is a squirrel cage blower, is prone to collect dirt and develop mold, and is not dedigned to be easily cleaned by the user. And on the 12k btu unit, there seems to be something in the software logic that prevents the unit ftom running at full capacity sometimes. It doesn't seem to have the cooling capacity of a traditional 12 k btu unit. I suggest a look at the Midea U Shaped Facebook users' group for info.

CommentsTitle: I love this unit, until it failed and Midea ghosted me. Midea does not stand behind their product.
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年10月10日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I bought this unit June 28, 2020. Installation was easy, it was quiet and super powerful. The app was fantastic, and interfaced with Alexa and Google Home seamlessly. It worked without flaw until May 2022. This is when I contacted Midea for support.An error code appeared on the front panel would display the error code PC-00, and the compressor would no longer run. I contacted Midea, and they had no clue what the error was, but took my information and told me that the warranty had expired. Over the next 4-months, Midea would call me back periodically and say that it may be an issue with the compressor, and that was still under warranty and they would check to see what they could do. August rolled around and I just got sick of waiting to hear back, so I uninstalled the unit and threw it away. Several weeks later near September Midea called back and I told them that I just thew the unit away as it had been months since I initially contacted them.I loved the unit, I loved how quite it was. I recommended it to everyone I knew. Had I known that the company would refuse to stand behind their product and that I would have wasted $500 on it, I would never have purchased. I cannot in good faith recommend anyone to buy this as if it breaks, the company will not support their product at all.

PurchasemModel_Color: 尺寸: 12000 BTU样式: 交流电

CommentsTitle: Slick design, good cooling, major issues with fan motor
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年9月27日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: Start with the good. I bought 4 of these for my home, and they install pretty easily. The design is good, I had hoped it wpuld reduce noise from the busy road near my house. Eh. But they themselves are very quiet! That is, until the fan motors fail. 2 of these units started emitting a high pitched wine anytime the fan is running. And of course it happened right after warranty period of one year. I am pretty mechanically skilled so changing out a motor is nbd to me, however this is where I have a bone to pick with Midea. They do not have a part number or sell this part that clearly fails and is an issue. Their support was very unhelpful, and the only way I replaced the motor was to open it up, get the part number, and order one from China on ebay. 70 bucks and an hour or so of repair time and it is quiet again, for how long? Who knows.  They should step up QC or extend warranty, and please ffs stock common parts that break. Maybe consider putting higher quality motors in a unit this pricey.

CommentsContent: Was really excited to get this ac unit going in my new apartment, as I moved somewhere that geographically didn't previously need built-in ac units (thanks climate change). Got everything set up, plugged in, and on, and it was very quiet, which I was impressed with, for about 30 seconds until it turned off! Turned out, there was an error code that ended up being a broken temperature sensor. After speaking with customer service, had to pack it all up and send it back. So I would recommend that anyone who does take a chance on this unit, please plug it in and test it before you get it set up in your window. It did blow cold and it was decently quiet, but I can't rate higher than three stars because it was a lot of trouble to go through for something that I just had to turn around and send right back. CommentsTitle: Good little a/c unit for the garage
CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年3月8日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I bought this for my garage. I live in Alabama. It is March 7, 2023 and was 86 degrees today. This air conditioner was delivered today, so you know I had to install it! Packaging was easy to remove. Now, I must have the world's smallest window in my garage. It's an old, metal frame window. When I read the description, it seemed like it would fit perfectly after measuring my window. The unit itself fit no problem. The issue was the side panels. It was just like an inch too big horizontally to fit my window. However, I remedied this issue by cutting an inch off of the left and right panel frames. Doing this allowed it to fit perfectly. The height was fine. The screws it comes with are kind of junk, but they work for what you need. Also, the mounting brackets didnt work for me, but again, I have some crazy windowns, apparently. So I made my modifications, installed it, and turned it on. Initially, it made a lot of noise kicking on the first time. Now it's quite quiet. It's blowing out some seriously cold air. I am in the process of insulating my garage (already did the garage doors, working on throwing up the panels on the rafters). I think this is going make working on my cars during the summer exponentially better. I don't know how it will do in the full blown summer yet, but I have high hopes. It will at least be tolerable. I'll update in a few months if anything goes wrong with it. Side note: if you want to insulate your garage with insulation panels, go to Lowes over home depot. I got Poly Pro 3/4" thick 4' x 8' panels for approx. $15 a piece. Just use a sharp utility knife to cut it and gorilla glue hot glue sticks to mount it to your garage door panels (you'll need to put blocks of the insulation panels on the garage doors before you install your cut panels or else the height won't be right. You'll know what I'm talking about if you go to do it.) Thank me later.

CommentsTitle: Not "like new" as stated, more like "like fell out window"
CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年2月13日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I took a chance on the "like new" return.  Since other reviews said it had a design fault of not having a drain hole for condensation, I figured I could solve it with a drill if needed.  The description of the one that I selected said the box had cosmetic damage, but that the unit was like new.  Well, the owners manual and installation guide was still wrapped in plastic, unopened.  That was the only part "like new"1. All the mounting hardware was missing.2. The fresh air vent was broke off and wedged in the fan blades.3. The front looked like it had been pried off, and then the prior owners seem to have tried to reattach it with silicone glue.4. The electrical plug was crushed, with the ground plug broke off.5. The plastic on the inside was covered with paint and silicone.6. The metal cabinet was badly crushed on one side, it looked like it might have fallen out of a window7. Despite the prior owners troubles, they must have got it working for a while, as the filter had a good layer of dog hair (or maybe cat or llama?) covering it. It was also obvious it had been run a while as their was plenty of residue from dried up water in the back, that hadn't drained out.Initially, I was just going to see if I could return it.  But I repair stuff, so I figured I might as well see what it would take to get it running.  I was able to take apart the cabinet, (after scraping illicit silicon of the screw heads) as per the instructions and get the fresh air vent and lever out of the fan blades and back in place. Also, since I had followed the instructions for taking off the front, I was able to get it back together correctly, unlike the prior owners.  The plug is missing the ground plug, clean broke off, but I was able to bend the other prongs into shape enough to plug it in for a brief test.  (I will have to cut the end off and add a new 3 prong repair before actually using it--it would be dangerous to use a metal appliance without a ground!  Unfortunately, this will mean cutting out the GFCI protection at the end of the cord. But I will be plugging it into a GFCI outlet, so that will provide the needed protection.)  After letting it run a while, it did start blowing cold air.  Living in the Pacific Northwest, I only plan to use it a few weeks during the summer. So I guess I will keep it.  But I won't be able to review any other qualities, or lack thereof, until then.

CommentsTitle: Cooled well while it worked, but did not last
CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年1月10日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I purchased the 6000 BTU unit in July 2021 for my 10x20 insulated workshop, and it worked ok in the south Texas heat and humidity, keeping the shop comfortable and dry.  In December 2022, the unit stopped cooling, and I reached out to the Midea customer service, who confirmed from my photos the unit was installed and maintained properly, but that the compressor most likely failed, and would not be covered, as it was out of warranty by a few months.  I am disappointed that this AC did not last any longer than this, as I have other window ACs that have lasted decades without much maintenance.  This one may be ok if you need it temporarily, but don't count on it to last.

You will need to buy a bracket of some sort to help hold it in position or else you will risk it falling out onto the ground.

     Long story short. Little ac unit works well. I use it to cool a bedroom roughy 144 square feet.The thermostat function really isn't very good at all in my opinion. The thermostat seemed to wait until the room was quite a bit warmer than I'd like before it would start the heat pump, usually it would just be blowing air. Thermostat was also pretty sensitive.  I just left it on the coldest setting and regulated the temperature of the room by opening the bedroom door to different angles.Didn't blow as cold of air as my other 10000 BTU unit, but I didn't expect it to.Air temp on the coldest setting was about 50 degrees Fahrenheit with an outside temperature of 89.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年9月5日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: Writing this review from the comfort of my 65 degree room while it’s 98 outside. I’m a 5’5” tall woman and I installed this alone without a struggle- getting it out of the box was the biggest challenge. My house is a 1916 Adobe craftsman with small original wood windows and no AC, and this unit was one of the only options that fit its 23” width. That being said, I only used one of the adjustable brackets since it wouldn’t fit with both despite what the measurements on the box said, and I screwed the window bar into the window frame a few extra times to make up for the lack of stabilizing parts that would’ve been on the other side. I also shimmed the unit with popsicle sticks underneath it to get the angle right for water collection as my window wouldn’t let me tilt it and still close it down, so far it seems to be fine. If you’re a light sleeper you’ll need earplugs to run it all night, but it’s not terribly loud, just makes a consistent hum sound. Overall this is a great little unit to keep a small room very cold.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年8月30日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: It cools, but it's pretty loud, and is definitely an energy hog like most window AC units. A few weeks into owning it I noticed the styrofoam on the inside of the unit was starting to crack in a certain place. I contacted support who asked me to send a picture of the crack and he would call me back once they received it. I sent the picture IMMEDIATELY and didn't get a call back until the following week. At which point they told me just to return it. Today is the last day of the return window, and I had already thrown away the box it came in. So now I would have to remove it from the window, and find some way to pack it up and send it back. To me it's just not even worth it. I used a bunch of foam insulation that I purchased along with cardboard and air sealing tape to make sure it's a good seal around the ac unit. It's simply too much of a pain to have to remove it and send it back when the unit is working. I'll just continue to use it until it breaks I guess. Midea customer support is terrible, and I won't be purchasing another product from them EVER.

CommentsContent: We ha ent had this unit long enough to know how energy efficient it is and we probably won't have it long enough.The noise level is just almost unbearable. It drowns out the TV so we have to turn it up loud, thus making conversation difficult. At this point it feels like a total waste of money. As far as cooling the area, it just barely covers.We have the bigger one in the back of the house. The U shaped unit and love it. Our plan was to add a new unit to the bedroom as well. But at this point, we wo t be doing that because there would be no way to sleep with this noise. It is ridiculous and if I could get my money back I would. Even if it would be alot of work to pack it back up and return. I am disabled so finding someone to help install was a challenge and then to uninstall would be just as difficult.I am just disappointed amd won't purchase then again, nor would I suggest anyone else do so without really doing your homework first.It is seldom I leave a negative review but it is truly warranted here.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年8月20日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I absolutely hate this AC. Bought it to replace a 20 year old unit thinking it would be quieter and more energy efficient. Exceeds db ratings using apple watch and it rattles and makes the worst noises even while on just fan mode. The digital thermostat doesn’t work. That is for the temp of the air coming out which I suppose makes sense. The light stays on all the time such that the room glows at night. And if you change the temperature it beeps loudly to wake up your sleeping partner. I have given  this AC weeks to get used to and while it does cool, is way too loud. I have to cool the room and then put a fan on at night. And I like loud white noise! If it stayed consistently noisy it would be fine. It is terrible with the changing levels if noisy motors. Do not recommend for a bedroom.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 April 7, 2023
CommentsContent: Summer can be brutal, especially when you don't have access to air conditioning. But fear not, because the Midea Duo 14,000 BTU Smart HE Inverter Ultra Quiet Portable Air Conditioner is here to keep you cool and comfortable no matter where you are! This versatile and efficient air conditioner is a game-changer for anyone looking to beat the heat without breaking the bank.The Midea Duo 14,000 BTU air conditioner is packed with features that make it one of the most advanced portable AC units on the market. With its Smart HE inverter technology, this unit delivers efficient and effective cooling while minimizing energy consumption. This means you can enjoy a refreshing cool breeze without worrying about your energy bill skyrocketing.One of the standout features of this portable AC is its ultra-quiet operation. Thanks to its unique design and powerful motor, the Midea Duo operates at a whisper-quiet sound level, allowing you to enjoy a peaceful and comfortable environment without any distracting noise.Another feature that sets the Midea Duo apart from other portable AC units is its ability to control the temperature and fan speed remotely. With the Midea Air app, you can adjust the temperature, fan speed, and even set a schedule for when you want the AC to turn on and off, all from your smartphone or tablet.The Midea Duo is also incredibly easy to set up and use. The unit comes with all the necessary components, including a window installation kit and a remote control. The installation process is straightforward and takes only a few minutes, so you can start enjoying cool air right away.The Midea Duo 14,000 BTU Smart HE Inverter Ultra Quiet Portable Air Conditioner is a must-have for anyone looking to beat the heat this summer. Its advanced features, energy efficiency, and ultra-quiet operation make it a standout choice among portable AC units. So, if you want to stay cool and comfortable no matter where you are, the Midea Duo is the perfect solution for you!
PurchasemModel_Size: Color: BlackSize: 14,000 BTU with Heat
PurchasemModel_Color: Color: BlackSize: 14,000 BTU with Heat

CommentsTitle: Extremely poor wiring. 5 blown GFIs on the circuit and this is what we find
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 April 6, 2023
CommentsContent:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
     The Midea Duo on the surface seems like a good unit. In fact, maybe it is if not for the extremely poor assembly of the electrical components on the one I received. The unit right out of the box, started blowing GFIs on the circuit. After well over $1000 in Electrician visits and parts replacements, we decided the issue is with the GFI on the unit itself.Opened up and find frayed power conductors - and not enough current carrying capacity because the strands are broken.So put a normal cord on there and got rid of the GFI on it  and wouldn’t you know it it actually functions correctly when the wires are not destroyed in the first place.Not only was this thing, a fire hazard the way it came out of the box, but a complete waste of everyone’s time.
PurchasemModel_Size: Color: BlackSize: 14,000 BTU with Heat
PurchasemModel_Color: Color: BlackSize: 14,000 BTU with Heat

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 April 5, 2023
CommentsContent: I naturally woke up a bit early this morning and tried to turn up the temp a bit so the room was warm when I got out of bed. Despite the room being 35° and my maxing out the temp and cycling through every mode this thing has for half an hour (with 3 - 10 minute pauses between), when I got out of bed to get ready for work the room was 37°The app is also terrible, all the text is in an Asian language for a good 10 - 15 seconds when you boot it up, it defaults to Celsius and you have to revert it to F EVERY TIME YOU OPEN THE APP, and none of the functions actually work as far as I could tell.Very much not recommended, when it decides it wants to work it's fine (hence the two stars), but I do not trust it to heat or cool my room one bit, and for $700 this is a laughably bad deal.

CommentsContent: Fantastic. Quiet, powerful, easy to use and setup. The adapters could have been a little better, but it's a minor quibble.I am using this in a Florida room in Florida that is typically akin to a greenhouse. There is zero insulation, a metal roof, and the thing was always warm even WITH other AC's running. I decided to try this one - and let me tell you, it's a miracle. The room is icy cold midday with the sun beating down and the temperature outside 96 degrees.It runs quiet, uses less electric than the previous units, and is simple to use and program. I couldn't be happier with it.

PurchasemModel_Color: Color: BlackSize: 14,000 BTU with Heat

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 March 24, 2023
CommentsContent: Heat and cool:Both work very well. Heat works best when it is warmer, but will still work when it is cold outside. The manual says that the heat does not work below 40F, but I had it it running at 20F and it worked great. Cool blows out very cold air.Noise:It can get noisy on high but on low, it is very quiet. Unit has an inverter fan and maybe compressor. Fan speed can be ajusted though the app (1%-100% and also low med hi), but on the remote and unit it is only Low Med High. Doesn't bother me too much though. It also has auto speed which I don't know which fan speed selction it uses.Remote:The remote annoys me. Not the thing itself, but how it oporates. When I cahange a setting on the remote, everything is fine. But when I change a setting on the unit, it does not change on the remote. This is very anoying because then I have to go through all the fan speeds or cylcle power on the remote ans hopefuly not short cylcle the unit. Other than that, the remote is great.Overall:Overall the unit was worth 700$. It keeps me warm and cool and has good controls. Does not make water very often, which is nice. Other than the remote, the unit is great.
PurchasemModel_Size: Color: BlackSize: 14,000 BTU with Heat

CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年3月19日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: This unit is compact, has wheels, a nice strong cord and plug-in, and is powerful for its size. It cools a normal-sized room quickly (with a window exhaust), and it dehumidifies a normal-sized room quickly as well. The best part is, unlike most models, this one does NOT need a window vent to dehumidify. It has a water release nozzle on the very bottom, making releasing water captured out of the air in your room very easy to empty. You do NOT have to empty the water with each used, but only after it builds up in the catch basin. Overall, this is great unit. It is heavy, so the wheels come in handy. If you have carpeting, sorry, but it will be hard to wheel around. If you have flat hard-surface floors you are in luck.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年3月3日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: First off the item arrived in a box beat up and old covered in dust. No bottom to the box just the styrofoam bottom and everything held together with shipping straps. Which meant when it came time to return it, I had no way to seal it. So I had to stuff everything into a wardrobe box and use a half a roll of tape because this thing is heavy.So just be aware that should you have to return this item, you better have your own box ready. Unless I just got some random piece of inventory that they did this too.The first two nights it worked very well. It cooled off our bedroom and it ran all night. The next night I woke up in the morning and it was no longer blowing air. The fan had turned off. I cycled the power and it started running again only to cut off a few hours later. The power stayed on but the fan stopped blowing air. The duration by which this thing would stay on would get smaller and smaller. To the point that by day four, it would only stay on for about 10 minutes before cycling off. It was not set to timer nor was it set to auto. It was set to high fan and cool with the timer off. I would have loved for this thing to work because it did cool off our room for the two days that it actually worked. But man what a complete pain in the butt it was to try to return this thing.

CommentsContent: This machine works great, but I live in a humid environment and the water tray is very small. It builds up sludge very quickly due to this and there is no way to access the water tray to fix the issue.  If you remove the exhaust hose you can maybe drop a tablet in there if you have good aim, but its very difficult and did not resolve my issue. As such about once a month I have to go outside and backwash the drain hole with water to attempt to dislodge and break up the sludge. This is sadly only temporary and very time consuming. I attempted to contact their support but they refused to help me at all and constantly asked for irrelevant information that I still supplied until eventually ignoring my request for support stating I had no warranty.I have attempted to resolve the issue myself by disassembling the unit but even with 100% of all screws removed it is still attached in multiple ways that are not intuitive or known, the last thing I want to do is break the device.So the rating is greatly lowered due to inability to resolve this issue and complete lack of support.

PurchasemModel_Color: 颜色: 黑色//白色尺寸: 12,000 BTU

CommentsDate: 评论于 2023年2月25日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I bought this because I live in a rental in Texas which is a very old and poorly insulated house. We do have central air but it costs a fortune to run and struggles with the Texas heat. The Midea is for a bedroom that's only about 300 square foot, which sounds like overkill but my old 10k BTU Black and Decker had trouble cooling to 80 on our 100 degree + days. This unit should also be cheaper to run since it's much more energy efficient.I really wanted the extra BTUs for cooling more than I wanted the heater but I'm already making use of it thanks to a brief late February cold snap.  I had accidentally set it to automatic mode while setting it up and very quickly realized it had warmed my room up, now I'm really glad I got the Duo. Before when we would have big temperature swings at night I'd have to go to sleep with the AC set to 72 and a space heater set to 66, otherwise I'd either go to bed sweating or wake up freezing. Now I've got one unit that keeps my room at 72 all night despite the wild temperature swings outside.As far as noise goes The Midea has a much more powerful fan so naturally, that is louder but it's compressor is actually much quieter than the Black and Decker.. no more loud buzzing when the AC kicks on.I'll try to update this review once we start getting 100-degree weather and I see how it handles Texas summers.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年11月29日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: During a recent failure of our building's central AC, our small server room hit 106 degrees F.  The surrounding rooms were 85 F with no heat on.  Uncomfortable for us and bad for the servers!We put this in there, ducted it to the room's one small window, set it to 80 degrees, and turned it on.An hour later, it was down to 95 F in the server room.  When we returned the next morning, it was 80 degrees in there, and the surrounding rooms were back to 72 F.Disaster averted!Compared to many others, the real advantage of this unit is that the duct is split between intake and outflow.  Meaning it has two loops internally.  One from and to the room and the second from and to the outside.  It exchanges the heat from the room loop to the outside loop and then sends the air from each back where it came from.This means it cools highly efficiently without creating negative pressure in the room by exhausting hot air outside without replacing it.This doesn't cool as much as central AC but costs less to operate.  For those times of year (spring and fall) when we only need AC because of the server room, this may save us money!If this thing can cool 2.5kW of servers and switches, it ought to do a pretty good job in any household application.The one thing I really can't weigh in on is the noise level; that room already has a "hearing protection required to enter" sign on the door.If I could change one thing, I would make the included duct longer.  But given our niche use, that's probably not an issue for most people.

CommentsTitle: Cool One Room at a Time
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年11月27日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: This item arrived on time as expected. It is heavy but easy to install. I should have ordered one with 10,000BTUS, but it managed to cool a slightly larger room area than it recommended. The room was never cold (nor do I like it that way). It was always comfortably cool, compared to the outdoors. It drained about 1-1/2 gallons of water into a bucket every 3-4hrs. on very warm days. So, I'd only run it (or set the timer) when I would be home to empty the bucket. I wouldn't say this unit runs EXTREMELY loud, but it isn't "quiet," either. Imagine the outside part of a window AC being in the house. If you're working at home, watching TV, or listening to anything else, it's distracting...but unavoidable. My overall critique is that a portable AC unit is meant to cool a single room, not an entire home. I accept that and limit myself to just one room. My goal is to stay nice and comfy, while I manage several chronic health issues. Considering the last summer with 90+degree weather, which melted my window blinds, having this portable device is much better than trying to sleep with no AC.

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年11月11日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: Unit Operating Temperature Range:Mode Temperature RangeCool 16°C ~ 35°C (60°F ~ 95°F)Dry 13°C ~ 35°C (55°F ~ 95°F)Heat Pump (for heat model) 5°C ~ 30°C (41°F ~ 86°F)The information above is extremely important. This unit works great if the outdoor temperature is within the operating temperature range. Once the temperature gets to 45°F the heater will struggle to blow hot air, and after the temperature gets to 41°F the heat pump will not start at all. The unit was designed to function this way.This unit also struggles to blow cold air once the temperature gets above 88°F, but the unit will continue to operate regardless of how hot it gets outside.Do not purchase this unit if you plan to use it in temperatures beyond the operating temperature range, because it simply cannot do it. In my experience, it seems to be more sensitive to the temperature inside the hose than the temperature inside the room. If I heat up the room with a separate heater the heat pump still will not engage if the outside temperature is out of operating range.

CommentsTitle: Low fan speed. Not that cold.
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年10月26日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I like how easy the set up was and the multiple ways of controlling the unit. I especially like that even of I'm not on the wifi network, that I can still control the unit from anywhere. One of the things I don't like is the fan speed. I feel it's pretty slow even at its highest setting. I wish there was a way to make it a little stronger. Also, having the vent point at its lowest setting, reduces the fan speed. I also feel that the coldest setting isn't that cold. Even for a room slightly smaller than its max capacity, it has a hard time keeping the room cold. On the hottest day, the ac unit felt like it was struggling to keep up. I'm sure if the room was a lot smaller, it would probably work fine. I gave it a 3 star rating mostly because of how much I liked the controls. And the Alexa feature is awesome.

CommentsTitle: Would be 5 star except it leaks in outside air defeating the purpose of a dual hose system
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年10月23日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I'd love to be able to recommend this unit. It is generally quiet (can get temporarily loud at random times which is bad in a bedroom overnight), has good features, a great remote, and sips power (relatively) but the unit is poorly sealed and as a result outside air easily enters your home via the intake hose when the unit is off, and when it is on it sucks air from your home to blow out the exhaust causing negative pressure and external air to be sucked in from other ingress points around the home.I have two of these units purchased 4 months apart. When I owned the first one it was installed in such a location that the negative pressure was not noticeable but when I brought a second unit and placed it in my bedroom I noticed it would pull the door open if not properly latched when the AC was turned on. Glad of the cool air and happy with the other features I put it to the back of my mind until the wildfire season came and the stink billowed out both units horribly. Placing my nose near the rear body vent it became clear that the smell was entering via the intake hose when the unit was off. I also noticed that on cooler nights a cold draft would drift from the same vents.I removed the dual hose from the unit to investigate and noticed large dust deposits around the poorly sealing areas around where the hose mates to the AC body. Flashing a flashlight around I also realized that the holes in the back of the unit for the plug to sit in go directly into the external air chamber allowing another place for air to mix. Similarly more holes further down the back of the unit do the same. Shine a flashlight around the underside and you will see light shine up unimpeded into the external air chamber. The hole in the bottom where the power cable exits is so large I can fit a whole finger in it (as well as the power cable) and that too goes straight into the external air chamber.In short, while I have no doubt this unit creates much less negative pressure issues than a single hose unit if you are expecting to keep outside air out (including pollution and smells) this unit will fail you miserably. It defeats one of the main selling points. It makes it useless as a heater in the winter as so much cold air will seep into the house defeating another major selling point. I'm sad I paid so much for a system that is so poorly designed and built. Remember, I have two of these unit and both are the same. They were purchased 4 months apart so this is not a one off or a problem with a specific lot.  It has a great feature set but this takes all that away. Wish I'd never brought them.
PurchasemModel_Size: 颜色: 黑色//白色尺寸: 14,000 BTU with Heat
PurchasemModel_Color: 颜色: 黑色//白色尺寸: 14,000 BTU with Heat

CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年10月19日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: This is perfect for what I needed & well worth my investment. I have a small bedroom with a window that requires vertical placement of the hose. In order to adjust the window insert, a saw was required. I opted to skip this step, as the space left by leaving the second piece out was no more than half an inch & I didn't want to fuss with it. The unit cools my space almost immediately and while there is some noise, I did not find it bothersome & in fact, it provided some nice extra white noise for sleeping. The remote control is also very handy, but the temp on the unit & the temp on the control sometimes read differently. I can decrease the temp on the remote to 72, but the unit doesn't respond & will still read 74. I find that if I make sure the remote is aiming straight for the unit, this happens less frequently. It's much like using a TV remote, it can't have anything blocking the remote and the receiver. Also, because it is portable, when my landlord sent out a notice that on October 1st all window units needed to be taken down, I didn't have to remove mine. I could continue to use it when the days were still warm. Overall, I'm super glad I made the choice to purchase this air conditioner and would recommend it to anyone looking for a simple set up unit that really works & doesn't break your bank.

CommentsTitle: Thoughts on the Midea Duo 14,000 BTU after two months of ownership
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年10月8日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent:
I waited a couple of months to see how the experience held up before submitting a review. Before purchase I had wondered about the drainage situation, performance, and overall noise level. I can address these points fully now.

The Midea Duo is a wonderful machine -- in a small bedroom (roughly 11x11) setting this to the lowest setting (60 degrees Fahrenheit) will actually take a space this small down into the mid / upper 50s. This is while the machine copes easily with southeastern heat and humidity outside.

I watched a Youtube reviewer test the noise level, and yes, that very low decibel rating is accurate with one caveat. The minimum noise level advertised only happens on low fan when the unit is in air circulation mode, no AC active -- the compressor running will easily exceed that level even on the lowest settings.

Don't get me wrong -- I work at a desk approximately four feet away from the unit and I have absolutely no issues doing my job. There is a quirk of the unit where when the AC first activates, it briefly will spin everything up to maximum even with the settings configured to low / medium. This will last about thirty seconds before the inverter tech kicks in and the compressor drops into background noise. This is my only pet peeve overall.

I am unsure as to why there isn't a "quiet mode" setting where it will run the compressor at a low setting more often for longer periods to maintain temperature versus needing to run full power for a bit. I would absolutely love this as a feature. Sending the compressor all the way to maximum and maximum fans briefly before stepping back and operating quietly is annoying, but I will note that I do not consider this loud enough to interrupt my day. Sitting further away will mitigate the issue completely.

The noise is never enough to wake me from sleep and isn't "terrible". On normal low AC settings outside of the initial "start up" where it runs full tilt, I would say it is about as loud as box fan set to medium-low. The full start up level of noise for the compressor is approximately as loud as a window AC running on full. You will definitely notice the different stages as it cycles up and down.

This thing will freeze you out of a room and quickly drop the temperature. I have never seen anything like it. Even dealing with Florida heat and humidity it was able to take a heat soaked room that was in the upper 80s down to the low 70s in a span of two hours.

I had some concerns about needing to drain this vs a comparable Whynter unit with their exhaust technology. Those concerns were unfounded -- even with Florida humidity I have never needed to drain the unit. I have checked multiple times but I have never had more than a few drops of water in the tank. The AC exhausts the water vapor efficiently out through the window and does not seem to accumulate much at all.

I have not needed to use the dehumidifying option, so that option may require more draining. For normal AC use you will probably not need to drain it often at all. If you live in a drier climate than Florida, you will probably never need to give draining it a second thought at all.

Installation was not difficult for one person and all needed adapters / panels are provided. Midea supplies extra panels and adapters in case you need extensions. I do recommend reviewing the instructions and using the dampening foam panels to keep outside noise and heat away. You can install it without the instructions (it's that simple) but your life will be much easier if you read the manual. :) Make sure to install the hose flow separator at the end of the vent or your performance will not be as great.

Once the foam is installed and the window secured with the included foam liners, outside noise is no worse than what it was before with the window closed. Midea has done very well in thinking of customer comfort.

Durability -- it cools just as well as it did on day one. It has, however, developed a very annoying rattle/vibration when the compressor spins up and goes to full power. This sounds like something vibrating loose in the unit and this happened a few weeks into ownership.

If I press my hand to the side of the unit this is goes away, so perhaps some piece of sound insulation has let go internally? I do not know if it is a defect since it is cooling perfectly, but I had to take away from the noise level stars because this is annoying and something I notice daily. Before it started doing this vibration-rattle the unit was much quieter.

Purely fan mode is wonderfully quiet, so I know this has to be coming from the compressor somehow.

Make sure to clean and check the filters, as the mesh is very fine and this unit needs the airflow to operate at best performance. I have not needed to use the heat function since we're still in the upper 80s and 90s, but will update as I use it.

The remote control is good for when you don't want to get out of bed to change settings, but I find the app to be easier to use. The remote can do most of the things the buttons on the unit will do minus a few options that require the unit buttons to be held down. The app will let you fine tune most settings on the unit and select fan speeds beyond low, medium, or high. I would like to see full control from the app with all settings that can be adjusted on the unit itself.

Our power bill did not increase by much using the AC. Part of this is probably helped by the Midea taking some of the strain off of the old (and inefficient) wall units here. I normally leave it set to low fan circulation and around 72 degrees on the AC. It uses much less power than a comparable window unit and I would absolutely not have anything other than an inverter driven AC at this point. The technology is that good.

Would I buy another Midea again? Absolutely. There are improvements they can make to the overall build quality (addressing the various vibrations / rattles that have appeared) and settings (a quiet AC mode would be greatly appreciated), but overall this is very comparable with the best that Whynter has to offer and the thoughtfulness of the app is wonderful.

It is not cheap, but the price gives you a tremendous performance and feature combination. I have no doubt that this would cool a large living room or combined space with ease. Thank you to Midea for saving me from Florida Summer!

Edit and followup: I attached two decibel measurements. The average for medium fan is 54 and the average for the unit running in AC mode is 61 with spikes up to 68.

I finally ran the heat and it works great, though it will collect a lot of humidity as condensation in the trays. The unit is very easy to drain, but you can also switch to dry mode to have the unit evaporate and exhaust the water.

CommentsContent: First, this is a 70lb unit.  It is heavy.  Second it works great for sash windows and sliding aluminum but has no adapter for french type side hinged windows.  Having said that, this is one nice unit.  It is quiet,  My last floor model shook the house and the fan was very noisy.  This one does not even disturb dinner from 8 feet away.  I don't know the decibels but they must be around 50 or so.  Quiet.  And it cools the place down.  I used it in a 1400 sq ft two br apartment with a 900 sq foot living room and dining area.  The apartment is 2nd floor and very warm.  This morning it was topping 85 at 9 am.  We installed this AC and blocked the window opening with the lightproof curtains to reduce the heat and force the hot air out.  Within 1/2 hour the temp inside the living room area was 72.  Wow.  That is a lot of area to cool.  But it did and it even cycled.  Bought another.  Love the heating too.  Saves gas big time.

     The unit itself is quiet, well designed, and functions well, as described in other reviews here. My main issues are with the window hardware and duct. The window mount and adapter is not sturdy enough and the clips that hold the parts together are not strong enough. My basement install reaches the limit of the exhaust duct length, so it applies a bit of force to the mounting clips. This scenario should be expected for this type of unit. The clips have a tendency to pop out constantly. The vertical adapter required for my sliding windows adds another set of weak clips that can pop out, causing additional grief. And that vertical adapter cannot fit into a vertical window with bulky trim around it without modification (tough to explain - see video). The window is now an obvious security risk since everything can be pushed in easily to access the window. Once everything is in place and settled, this unit has worked very well for cooling my ~550 sq. ft. space. I'll have to update my review with my experience using the heating function after the winter months.

CommentsTitle: Cools Like a Beast, but Doesn't Dehumidify.
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年9月25日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: First-day use impressions: It cools like a beast and works way better than our previous portable AC. Powerfan and cooling with lots of automated options and controls via phone app, remote, or Alexa.  The only negative thing I have to say about it is that I have not been able to get the dry mode to lower humidity at all. It doesn't seem to do anything in DRY mode more than it does in Cool mode. There is no drainage at all in DRY mode, in fact, nothing changes when I switch between Cool and Dry. I thought the fan was supposed to slow down, but it doesn't. The dry mode was one of the main reasons why I bought this unit so for that I had to subtract a few stars. I'll contact support on Monday to see if something is wrong with the unit and update you.Update: I contacted support and they had no real solutions and told me that I have to disconnect the hose from the outside vent in DRY mode!?!?!?, which I tried, and then it just heated up the room and didn't dry any better. This seems like a huge design flaw and had I known it I probably wouldn't have purchased it Their only suggestion was to return it, and that seems like a huge hassle, but may be best.Six-month update: It still works like a beast and I can attest that it uses much less energy than my last unit. The biggest issue I have found so far is the plastic clips that connect the hose to the window piece are plastic. I have broken two of them already and I don't see how they wouldn't break fairly easily after a few times connecting and disconnecting the hose. Plan on replacing this piece every few years. These should have been made of stronger materials. Being that this connection is a very crucial part of its function I am lowering my score another star. If it can't connect to the window it basically useless.

CommentsTitle: Window kit is awful. AC itself is good (but useless without good window kit)
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年9月19日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: I would have given this AC 5 stars if the window adapter wasn’t such an awful piece of junk. The adapter piece is very stiff and when we were connecting it, the attachment piece snapped clean off. We read other reviews that complained about the window kit so we were very careful and it still broke. I contacted the manufacturer and they sent me a link to purchase a replacement piece  for $80 (and $10 shipping so $90 total). We tried to tape it, but it just wouldn’t hold so we caved and ordered the replacement. Hopefully it doesn’t break a second time. The whole window panel piece just isn’t very sturdy. Definitely prepare to get creative with installation if you do make this purchase.The AC itself is great, except that you can’t really turn it or have it stand at an angle because the hose is very stiff and it needs to stand right where your window opening is. But it’s quieter than our other AC and cools our room well.Bottom line: I would have rather just paid $100 extra from the beginning if it meant the window kit would be good quality. Overall, I’m glad we got this AC. Just hoping the manufacturer listens to feedback and improves the window kit.

CommentsTitle: The opening to the outside has NO protection
CommentsDate: 评论于 2022年9月14日 在美国 🇺🇸 发布
CommentsContent: The A/C works very well.The intake/exhaust is open to the outside when installed.  Rain can get in (and settle in the intake/exhaust hose).  Birds can get into the hose. Squirrels and other vermin can get into the hose.I asked Midea if they had any type of cover/screen.  They said no and that I should contact my local hardware store.So, I am building a hood (that I must attach to my exterior brick wall) and also cover the intake/exhaust with some type of mesh to keep the critters out). If you are not a handyman, be prepared to contract one OR just live with the rain/critters.Not a trivial project, but it just seems a hood/screen should be part of the package.PS: this screen from Amazon seems like a good purchase: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09FPRTKJL?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_detailsNow exploring some weatherproof lumber to build a hood outside the lower part of my window that holds the intake/exhaust and attaches to the brick outer wall.
